pt and produce a diff file as a output of this script.

Thanks,
Rohit


---=
 In junit@yahoogroups.com, "cant_jim" <jimcant@...> wrote:
>
> I assume the=
se reports are in files. Couldn't you just 'diff' them (assuming your on a =
nice *nix system; I guess on Windows you need to resort to WinDiff) or is t=
here something I don't understand about the problem
>    diff -bw ReportA R=
eportB 
> should do the trick.  You'll get differences between them if the =
running times of tests are different but the serious differences should be =
obvious.
> 
> Are you going to asses the differences visually or is this go=
ing to be in a script; if the latter, the problem is more interesting (i.e.=
 harder).
> 
> Hope this helps
> 
> jim
> 
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, =
"rohitkulkarni15" <rohitkulkarni15@> wrote:
> >
> > Hi,
> > 
> > Currently,=
 I have a requirement of comparing results of two JUnit reports(with same s=
et of tests).

ate a diff report that mentions only those tests whose status is different =
as compared to the 1st result
> > 
> > i.e. If i have report A and report B=
, how to get the list of differences between these two reports.
> > 
> > Ca=
n someone please guide me on how to do this?
> >

> > Rohit
